H0.text: Liquid to gas is the state of matter change that occurs when a cup of water at room temperature is put in a freezer.

H1.text: Gas to liquid is the state of matter change that a cup of water at room temperature undergoes when it is put in a freezer.

H2.text: Liquid to solid is the state of matter change that occurs when a cup of water at room temperature is put in a freezer.

H3.text: Solid to liquid is the state of matter change that occurs when a cup of water at room temperature is put in a freezer.

A4.text: At a pressure of one atmosphere (atm), ice melts or water freezes (solidifies) at 0 °C (32 °F).

A5.text: The addition or removal of heat can cause phase transitions: freezing (water to ice), melting (ice to water), vaporization (water to vapor), condensation (vapor to water), sublimation (ice to vapor) and deposition (vapor to ice).
